overview: From 2025-11-01 to 2025-12-01, ethereum-optimism/infra had 15 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 59 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [acceptance] Test: base; verify contracts
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Ensure all deployed contracts are verified.

### Implementation
Use [op-devstack](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/op-devstack).

topIssues.title: [acceptance] Test: base; Transaction Type Support Test
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Verify all Ethereum transaction types (legacy, EIP-1559, etc.) are supported.

### Implementation
Use [op-devstack](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/op-devstack) to set up a test network. Create and submit transactions of each supported type (legacy, EIP-1559, EIP-2930) with various parameter combinations. Verify all transaction types are accepted, processed correctly, and result in the expected state changes.

topIssues.title: [acceptance] Test: base; Node Failure and Recovery Test
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Test system behavior when nodes fail and come back online.

### Implementation
Set up a multi-node test network using [op-devstack](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/op-devstack). Simulate various node failure scenarios (crash, resource exhaustion, network disconnection) for different node types. Restart failed nodes and verify they correctly synchronize and resume normal operation without data corruption or chain inconsistencies.

topIssues.title: [acceptance] Test: base; Block Proposal and Finalization Latency
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Measure and validate block time consistency and finalization speed.

### Implementation
Deploy a test network using [op-devstack](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/op-devstack). Create timing instrumentation to measure the latency between transaction submission, inclusion in a block proposal, and block finalization. Collect statistics over multiple blocks under different network conditions and validate consistency against expected block times.

topIssues.title: [acceptance] Test: base; Transaction Throughput Measurement
topIssues.author: scharissis
topIssues.body:
Measure maximum transactions per second under various load conditions.

### Implementation
Using op-devstack, set up a test network and deploy a transaction generator that creates varying loads of simple and complex transactions. Measure transaction confirmation rates over fixed time periods at different load levels. Calculate transactions per second for each load scenario and identify the maximum sustainable throughput before degradation.

topPRs.title: ci: add GitHub Actions workflows to build and attest infra Docker images
topPRs.author: falcorocks
topPRs.body: This pull request adds GitHub Actions workflows to build attest and sign Docker images for all infra components. ### Changes * Added ten workflow files for all infra components: * `.github/workflows/op-conductor-mon.yml` * `.github/workflows/op-conductor-ops.yml` * `.github/workflows/op-signer.yml` * `.github/workflows/op-txproxy.yml` * `.github/workflows/peer-mgmt-service.yml` * `.github/workflows/op-ufm.yml` * `.github/workflows/proxyd.yml` * `.github/workflows/cci-stats.yml` * `.github/workflows/op-acceptor.yml` * `.github/workflows/replica-healthcheck.yml` * Each workflow uses the reusable workflow from `ethereum-optimism/factory` * Adds GitHub Actions Docker image builds alongside existing CircleCI builds ### Security Benefits * SLSA Build Level 3 in-toto provenance attestation attached to images * Attestations signed with Sigstore (provides same benefit as image signatures) * Users can verify that images were built from this repository, from a specific branch/tag, and that they were not tampered * Attestations will appear in the repository [attestations page](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/infra/attestations)

topPRs.title: proxyd: security oriented fixes
topPRs.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topPRs.body:
Signed-off-by: Yashvardhan Kukreja <yashvardhan@oplabs.co>

**Tests**

Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.

**Additional context**

Add any other context about the problem you're solving.

**Metadata**

- Fixes #[Link to Issue]

topPRs.title: Add all potential RPC method mappings
topPRs.author: justincavery
topPRs.body:
Added commented out multiple RPC method mappings for clarity. 

We were moving from an `nginx` configuration which allowed for all methods to be passed through and found it difficult to define the right list for `proxyd` to support our Graph Indexers.

topPRs.title: chore(deps): bump golang.org/x/crypto from 0.31.0 to 0.45.0 in /peer-mgmt-service
topPRs.author: dependabot
topPRs.body:
Bumps [golang.org/x/crypto](https://github.com/golang/crypto) from 0.31.0 to 0.45.0.
Commits
  • 4e0068c go.mod: update golang.org/x dependencies
  • e79546e ssh: curb GSSAPI DoS risk by limiting number of specified OIDs
  • f91f7a7 ssh/agent: prevent panic on malformed constraint
  • 2df4153 acme/autocert: let automatic renewal work with short lifetime certs
  • bcf6a84 acme: pass context to request
  • b4f2b62 ssh: fix error message on unsupported cipher
  • 79ec3a5 ssh: allow to bind to a hostname in remote forwarding
  • 122a78f go.mod: update golang.org/x dependencies
  • c0531f9 all: eliminate vet diagnostics
  • 0997000 all: fix some comments
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=golang.org/x/crypto&package-manager=go_modules&previous-version=0.31.0&new-version=0.45.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/infra/network/alerts).

topPRs.title: chore(deps): bump github.com/consensys/gnark-crypto from 0.12.1 to 0.18.1 in /op-txproxy
topPRs.author: dependabot
topPRs.body:
Bumps [github.com/consensys/gnark-crypto](https://github.com/consensys/gnark-crypto) from 0.12.1 to 0.18.1.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/consensys/gnark-crypto's releases.

v0.18.1

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Consensys/gnark-crypto/compare/v0.18.0...v0.18.1

v0.18.0

What's Changed

  • perf: disable cobra bit reverse for small fields by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#662
  • perf: adds avx512 poseidon2 for small fields by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#665
  • GKR Gate Registry by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#652
  • chore: remove unused benchmark script by @​ivokub in Consensys/gnark-crypto#675
  • Remove GKR from gnark-crypto by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#670
  • feat: make <31 bit field generated using uint32 by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#676
  • refactor: hash to curve by @​ivokub in Consensys/gnark-crypto#674
  • fix: Eisenstein Half-GCD convergence by @​feltroidprime in Consensys/gnark-crypto#680
  • feat/hashregistry by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#687
  • Feat/fftext by @​YaoJGalteland in Consensys/gnark-crypto#684
  • Feat/vortex options by @​ThomasPiellard in Consensys/gnark-crypto#689
  • [secp256k1]: replace outdated link to article by @​gap-editor in Consensys/gnark-crypto#690
  • feat: remove dependency on internal package in ecc.go by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#693

New Contributors

  • @​feltroidprime made their first contribution in Consensys/gnark-crypto#680
  • @​YaoJGalteland made their first contribution in Consensys/gnark-crypto#684
  • @​gap-editor made their first contribution in Consensys/gnark-crypto#690

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Consensys/gnark-crypto/compare/v0.17.0...v0.18.0

v0.17.0

What's Changed

  • fix: missing Poseidon2 round keys by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#621
  • feat: Poseidon2 Hash Instantiation for BLS12-377 by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#623
  • feat: add Grumpkin elliptic curve (2-cycle with BN254) by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#625
  • Perf: Poseidon2 GKR circuit by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#628
  • feat: add sis avx512 and fft avx512 for koalabear by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#622
  • InterpolateOnRange refactor by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#634
  • chore: add auto close PR workflow by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#638
  • perf: subgroup membership by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#635
  • feat: poseidon2 for koala-bear, baby-bear and goldilocks by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#629
  • chore: generify poseidon2 parameters for other curves/fr by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#636
  • feat: baby-bear and koala-bear extensions of degree 4 by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#643
  • fix: ensure fast path is taken only with fixed bound and degree by @​gbotrel in Consensys/gnark-crypto#651
  • Poseidon2 compression for small fields by @​Tabaie in Consensys/gnark-crypto#644
  • fix: poseidon2 templates by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#648
  • test: improve NAF decomposition test coverage by @​DeVikingMark in Consensys/gnark-crypto#617
  • refactor: generate code for poseidon2_test by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#660
  • test(bn254, bls12-381): test points intentionally not on sugroups G1/2 by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#658
  • refactor: generify small fields extensions by @​yelhousni in Consensys/gnark-crypto#647

New Contributors

  • @​DeVikingMark made their first contribution in Consensys/gnark-crypto#617

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from github.com/consensys/gnark-crypto's changelog.

[v0.18.1] - 2025-10-28

Docs

  • add CHANGELOG for 0.18.1

Perf

  • limit memory allocation during Vector deserialization (#759)

[v0.18.0] - 2025-06-09

Chore

Docs

Experiment

Feat

Fix

Perf

  • remove useless copies in e4 mul by elem (#667)

Refactor

[v0.17.0] - 2025-03-11

Chore

  • remove useless github workflow
  • generify poseidon2 parameters for other curves/fr (#636)
  • add auto close PR workflow (#638)

Feat

  • baby-bear and koala-bear extensions of degree 4 (#643)

  • add sis avx512 and fft avx512 for koalabear (#622)

... (truncated)

topContributors.summary: sbvegan: Focused on critical documentation and registry updates, merging 12 PRs to support network communications and upgrades. They executed a major update to notice pages for communications in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1847` (+2155/-698 lines) and managed key details for the Jovian hard fork, including updating release information in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1852`. In addition to these direct contributions, sbvegan was an active collaborator, providing 25 code reviews. This work shows a primary focus on maintaining and improving project documentation.

devin-ai-integration: Focused on improving the quality and clarity of documentation and contract specifications for the Ethereum Optimism project. They made several impactful enhancements to the specifications, most notably by linking defined terms to their definitions in a large refactor (`specs#856`, +274/-225 lines), adding a new `SuperFaultDisputeGame` variant (`specs#852`), and cleaning up existing contract specs (`specs#853`, `specs#854`). This was complemented by a broad effort across 12 separate pull requests to fix typos and grammatical errors throughout the `ethereum-optimism/docs` repository, demonstrating a clear focus on improving overall documentation and specification quality.

ajsutton: Focused on supporting the team through collaboration this month. They contributed to project progress by providing 3 pull request reviews, which included 2 approvals. Additionally, they participated in discussions by commenting on one issue.
joshklop: No activity this month.

smartcontracts: Focused on improving CI processes and contributing to future design this month, merging a pull request to enhance upgrade tests in CI (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18133). They also authored a significant design document for OPCM v2 (ethereum-optimism/design-docs#353) and were highly engaged in supporting the team's work, providing 30 code reviews. Their contributions show a focus on development infrastructure, design, and team collaboration.

maurelian: This month, maurelian focused on development tooling and new features, merging a PR to optimize the build process in `op-deployers` (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18130). They also proposed a new `DeployFeesDepositor` script (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18223) and provided significant team support by conducting 16 code reviews. Based on their code changes, their work was primarily centered on feature development and testing.

bitwiseguy: This month, bitwiseguy focused on maintaining the deployment tooling, with their primary contribution being the support for the `op-contracts/v5.0.0-rc.2` upgrade in the `op-deployer` (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18154). They also fixed related test timeouts in the CLI runner via PR ethereum-optimism/optimism#18179. In addition to their own changes, they actively supported the team by providing 8 code reviews. This work shows a primary focus on bug fixes and testing within the deployment process.

pcw109550: Focused on node synchronization within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, proposing a significant Proof of Concept for a "Light CL" in `op-node` (optimism#18196). In support of this effort, they identified and created three issues related to node syncing and potential bugs (#18124, #18125, #18126). While their primary development work was on this open PR, they also actively supported the team by conducting 14 code reviews. Their code changes, which modified 34 files, were primarily focused on bug fixes and tests.
geoknee: Contributed by reviewing and approving one pull request.

sebastianst: Focused on significant refactoring and modularization within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository to improve its core architecture. They led this effort by moving fork names into a new package (#18121) and relocating package predeploys (#18145), both substantial architectural changes. Alongside this refactoring, sebastianst also fixed a configuration loading bug in the batch decoder (#18209) and actively supported the team by providing 17 code reviews.

JosepBove: Focused on operational maintenance in the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` repository, merging two PRs to update an RPC configuration and apply a bugfix for betanets (#1281, #1280). They were also an active collaborator, providing 7 reviews and 5 comments on other pull requests. Their contributions were primarily focused on bug fixes and other work, with a third of their file modifications involving documentation.
Inphi: No activity this month.

mds1: Focused on CI and deployment pipeline maintenance this month, merging 6 small PRs to address bugs and configuration issues. Their contributions included updating CLI flags for the op-deployer (optimism#18143) and renaming CI jobs to align with required checks (optimism#18139). In addition to their own fixes, mds1 was an active collaborator, providing 19 code reviews for teammates. This activity shows a primary focus on bug fixes and configuration changes to ensure system stability.

aliersh: Focused on repository maintenance and developer experience, merging three pull requests this month. Their most impactful contribution was a refactor in ethereum-optimism/optimism#18212 that removed a 157-line script, simplifying the codebase. They also improved repository organization by moving specifications in ethereum-optimism/specs#851 and enhanced CI guidance for developers in ethereum-optimism/optimism#18127. This work, along with 5 code reviews, demonstrates a focus on refactoring and bug fixes, with changes primarily affecting test files.

nonsense: Focused on improving the reliability and efficiency of the Optimism stack, merging four pull requests across multiple repositories. Their most impactful contributions included restricting the transaction mempool to trusted peers in `ethereum-optimism/op-geth#719` and executing a significant refactor of the `op-batcher` in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18174`. In addition to their own code, they supported the team by providing 6 code reviews. Their work was primarily focused on feature enhancements and bug fixes, with changes distributed across both application code and tests.

opgitgovernance: This month, opgitgovernance focused on automated maintenance and improving test stability across repositories. They opened pull requests in `optimism` to address test flakiness (#18106, #18107) and submitted automated code generation updates to `superchain-registry` (#1137, #1138). Additionally, they generated automated metrics reports by opening and closing two issues in the `docs` repository (#1825, #1826), with their code changes primarily touching tests and configuration files.
almanax-ai: No activity this month.

Vaios0x: Focused on proposing a broad set of enhancements for the `op-node` component within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, opening 33 pull requests this month. The proposed work includes significant new features such as a retry system with exponential backoff (#18116), improved context and timeout management (#18118), and enhanced error handling (#18113). Additionally, Vaios0x submitted comprehensive architecture documentation (#18117) and numerous other documentation improvements, though none of this work has been merged.
janjakubnanista: No activity this month.

scharissis: Focused on maintenance and reliability within the acceptance testing framework this month. They merged several small PRs for chores and CI fixes, including updating a dependency version in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18120` and correcting a CI token in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18156`. Additionally, scharissis proactively identified and created issues to address a flaky test (`#17548`) and report unused tests (`#16273`). Their contributions centered on test and configuration file modifications.

Wazabie: This month, Wazabie's primary effort involved a significant volume of code changes (+5050/-1311 lines) across 82 commits, which is categorized as 'other work'. They merged one pull request in `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` to update the OPCMv500 template (#1282) and also provided one review approval. Based on the files modified, their work was heavily concentrated on improving tests and documentation.

axelKingsley: Focused on developing the `op-supernode` component, merging a key feature PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18141) to implement runnable and RPC activities with a heartbeat example. They continued this effort with three additional open PRs to expand `op-supernode` functionality, including a Superroot API and P2P capabilities. In addition to their implementation work, they supported the team by providing 5 code reviews. Axel's code contributions this month were primarily focused on new feature work, with smaller efforts dedicated to bugfixes and documentation.
serpixel: No activity this month.

ZakAyesh: Focused on improving documentation for the Optimism ecosystem, merging two pull requests in `ethereum-optimism/docs`. They added new configuration sections for `minBaseFee` and `DA Footprint` (docs#1830) and authored a new guide on setting the minimum base fee (docs#1849). In addition to this documentation work, ZakAyesh contributed 4 code reviews and has an open pull request to add a key handback task in `superchain-ops` (#1284).

teddyknox: This month, teddyknox's primary contribution was merging a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` to "Debounce FCU Update" (#18234). In addition to this code change, they engaged in project discussions by commenting on 2 issues and 3 pull requests. Their activity was focused on code modifications within the optimism repository.
falcorocks: Supported the team through code review, approving 2 pull requests this month.

alcueca: This month, alcueca focused on security hardening by addressing audit findings for Safer Safes in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They merged two pull requests to implement these fixes (#18147, #18172), with the latter involving over 950 lines of changes. In addition to this work, they also provided 4 code reviews. Their contributions were primarily classified as bug fixes, with modifications concentrated in configuration and test files.

ccerv1: Focused on generating and refining results within the `ethereum-optimism/Retro-Funding` repository this month. They delivered multiple large-scale data updates, including draft results for QA (PR #82) and a significant post-backfill update involving over 34k lines added and removed (PR #84). Additionally, ccerv1 resolved an important issue with the retroactive calculation logic for projects affected by downtime (PR #83), demonstrating a focus on both bug fixes and data management.

AmadiMichael: Focused on significant code cleanup and refactoring within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this month. Their primary contribution was merging PR #18122, a substantial refactor that removed the "DeployProxy" and 549 lines of code. In addition to this work, they were an active reviewer, providing 7 reviews across the project. This activity reflects a primary focus on bug fixes, with changes impacting both code and test files.

chuxinh: This month, chuxinh's efforts were concentrated on the `ethereum-optimism/op-analytics` repository, where they landed two pull requests. Their most significant contribution was a massive data update in PR #1763, which introduced over 36,000 lines of changes. This work, along with rerunning the Orderly process in PR #1764, indicates a clear focus on maintaining and updating analytics data.

MSilb7: Made significant updates within the `ethereum-optimism/op-analytics` repository this month, merging two substantial pull requests.
